content.question: Which of the following expressions is equal to <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, the fraction with numerator 17 x, plus 4, and denominator 3 times x squared, minus 7 x, minus 6, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><mn>17</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>7</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, the fraction with numerator 2, and denominator x minus 3, end fraction, d x, plus, the integral from, 0 to 2, of, the fraction with numerator 5, and denominator 3 x, plus 2, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mo>∫</mo><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, the fraction with numerator 5, and denominator x minus 3, end fraction, d x, plus, the integral from, 0 to 2, of, the fraction with numerator 2, and denominator 3 x, plus 2, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, the fraction with numerator 4, and denominator x minus 3, end fraction, d x, plus, the integral from, 0 to 2, of, the fraction with numerator 17 x, and denominator 3 x, plus 2, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>17</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, the fraction with numerator 17 x, and denominator x minus 3, end fraction, d x, plus, the integral from, 0 to 2, of, the fraction with numerator 4, and denominator 3 x, plus 2, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><mn>17</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the integral from, 0 to 2, of, the fraction with numerator 5, and denominator x minus 3, end fraction, d x, plus, the integral from, 0 to 2, of, the fraction with numerator 2, and denominator 3 x, plus 2, end fraction, d x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.12: (BC ONLY) Integrating Using Linear Partial Fractions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
